children.subject:
If you're looking to be as competitive as possible for grad schools, then you might want to do research over the summer. But otherwise, I would recommend interning because it's a good experience to have and it's always nice to make a bit of money. You'll still have junior summer to do research, and you'll probably be much more productive during junior summer since you'll know a lot more.

I wrote this assuming that you haven't interned at a Silicon Valley company before and assuming that you're not graduating in 3 years.

history.content:
I was wondering if I could ask your guys advice on what i should do this summer. I received an offer to intern at a self driving car company, but I was wondering if maybe I should consider researching full time over the summer instead. For context, I plan on going to grad school.

P.S. I’m also a sophomore.

Thank you!
history.subject: Summer Research VS Summer Internship
